preferences.critical_slack_less_than: Tasks are critical if slack is less than:

errors.general_desc: Something went wrong. Please try again.
errors.store_desc: A critical error occurred in the application state. It is recommended to reload the page to restore functionality.
errors.network_desc: Failed to establish a connection with the server. Please check your internet connection.

descriptions.network: Visualization of dependencies between project tasks
descriptions.tracking: Tracking actual progress against planned baseline
descriptions.wbs: Hierarchical decomposition of project work structure
descriptions.task_sheet: Complete list of project tasks with detailed parameters
descriptions.task_usage: Analysis of work distribution over time for each task
descriptions.calendar: Overview of tasks and events in calendar view

sheets.name: Name
sheets.type_tooltip:
Work: Price per time (h/day)
Material: Price per unit (kg/pcs)
Cost: One-time fixed amount
sheets.material_label_tooltip: Unit of measure? (e.g.: kg, pcs, liters, bags)
sheets.max_units_tooltip:
Work: % of human availability
Material: total quantity (e.g. 500 kg)
sheets.std_rate_tooltip:
Work: Price for 1 hour of work
Material: Price for 1 unit (kg/pcs)
Cost: Total payment amount
sheets.calendar_tooltip: Working calendar defining the resource's schedule
sheets.available_stat_tooltip:
Resources with free capacity.

Resource load is less than its maximum capacity (maxUnits).
sheets.busy_stat_tooltip:
Resources with active assignments.

Resources assigned to at least one task in the project.
sheets.overload_stat_tooltip:
Overloaded resources.

Total workload exceeds the resource's maximum capacity.
sheets.active_stat_tooltip:
Total number of tasks in the project.

Includes all tasks regardless of their completion status.
sheets.completed_stat_tooltip:
Tasks with 100% progress.

Fully completed work items that require no further action.
sheets.in_progress_stat_tooltip:
Tasks with progress from 1% to 99%.

Active work items that have been started but not yet completed.
sheets.not_started_stat_tooltip:
Tasks with 0% progress.

Planned work items waiting to begin.
sheets.no_workload_hint: Assign the resource to tasks to see workload
sheets.normal_load_tooltip:
Days when the resource's total workload does not exceed 100%.

This means the resource is working within their capacity. Workload is calculated from all active task assignments on that day.

Example: John is assigned to Task A (50%) and Task B (30%) → 80% workload → normal.
sheets.overload_tooltip:
Days when the resource's total workload EXCEEDS 100%.

This is a critical situation — the resource cannot physically complete all the work. Task redistribution or team expansion is required.

Example: Marina is assigned to Task X (100%) and Task Y (100%) → 200% workload → overload.
sheets.capacity_limit_tooltip:
Horizontal line indicating 100% resource capacity.

This is the standard workload (e.g., 8 hours per day). Bars above this line indicate overload, below indicate underutilization.

Use as a visual reference to assess team workload balance.
sheets.calc_help_material: Material: Cost = Rate * Quantity. Time does NOT affect price. (e.g.: $2/pcs * 500pcs = $1000)
sheets.calc_help_cost: Cost: Fixed amount. Just added to the task once (tickets, fees).

task_props.title: Task Properties
task_props.name: Task Name
task_props.summary_hint: Summary task progress is calculated automatically based on subtasks
task_props.predecessors_hint: Specify task IDs that must be completed before this task starts
task_props.successors_hint: Tasks that depend on completion of this task
task_props.calc_help_material: Material: Cost = Rate * Quantity. Time does NOT affect price. (e.g.: $2/pcs * 500pcs = $1000)
task_props.calc_help_cost: Cost: Fixed amount. Just added to the task once (tickets, fees).
task_props.constraint_disabled_hint: Enable "Honor required dates" in project options to edit.
task_props.constraint_disabled_full_hint: Enable "Honor required dates" in project options to use date constraints.

asap.label: As Soon As Possible (ASAP)
asap.description:
Task starts at the earliest possible date considering dependencies.

Used by default for flexible scheduling.
asap.hint: Task will start as early as possible considering dependencies. Default mode for flexible scheduling.

alap.label: As Late As Possible (ALAP)
alap.description:
Task starts as late as possible without delaying project end date.

Used to optimize resource usage.
alap.hint: Task will start as late as possible without delaying project completion. Used for delayed start.

mso.label: Must Start On (MSO)
mso.description:
Task MUST start on the specified date, regardless of dependencies.

STRICT constraint! May create conflicts with other tasks.

Requires date selection.
mso.hint: Task MUST start exactly on the specified date. Violation will cause a conflict (red highlight on chart).

mfo.label: Must Finish On (MFO)
mfo.description:
Task MUST finish on the specified date.

STRICT constraint! May create schedule conflicts.

Requires date selection.
mfo.hint: Task MUST finish exactly on the specified date. Violation will cause a conflict.

snet.label: Start No Earlier Than (SNET)
snet.description:
Task cannot start before the specified date, but can start later (if delayed).

Softer than MSO, allows flexibility.

Requires date selection.
snet.hint: Task cannot start before the specified date, but can start later. Semi-flexible constraint.

snlt.label: Start No Later Than (SNLT)
snlt.description:
Task must start no later than the specified date.

Used to control work start deadlines.

Requires date selection.
snlt.hint: Task cannot start later than the specified date, but can start earlier. Semi-flexible constraint.

fnet.label: Finish No Earlier Than (FNET)
fnet.description:
Task cannot finish before the specified date.

Useful for synchronization with external events or deliveries.

Requires date selection.
fnet.hint: Task cannot finish before the specified date. Semi-flexible constraint.

fnlt.label: Finish No Later Than (FNLT)
fnlt.description:
Task must finish no later than the specified date.

Used for hard deadlines with some scheduling flexibility.

Requires date selection.
fnlt.hint: Task cannot finish later than the specified date. Semi-flexible constraint.

help.hierarchy_restriction: Cannot increase indent: indent the task above first
help.network_footer_tip: Changes to progress and names are synchronized with the Gantt chart.
help.critical_path_tip: Chain of tasks determining the project end date. Delaying any of these will delay the entire project.
help.regular_task_tip: Tasks with time slack. They can be slightly moved without risking the overall project deadline.

taskTypes.title: Task Types
taskTypes.normalDesc: (blue bars): Atomic work items with fixed duration
taskTypes.summaryDesc: (black brackets): Groups of subtasks. Their dates are calculated automatically
taskTypes.note: Summary tasks cannot be dragged — they depend on their children

criticalPath.title: Critical Path (Pulse Mode)
criticalPath.whatDesc: Sequence of tasks that determine the minimum project duration
criticalPath.howDesc: Click the 'Pulse' button (Activity icon) on the toolbar
criticalPath.visualDesc: Critical tasks are highlighted in red
criticalPath.slackDesc: Tooltip shows how many days a task can be delayed

dependencies.title: Task Links
dependencies.desc: Tasks can be linked together with arrows. Linked tasks execute sequentially: the next task won't start until the previous one is completed.
dependencies.visual: Arrows visually show the order of work execution and help control the sequence of project phases.
dependencies.noSummary: Cannot link regular task to summary task

baseline.title: Baseline
baseline.whyDesc: Captures the original schedule for comparison with current state
baseline.visualDesc: Gray bars under current tasks show original dates

colorModes.title: Color Modes
colorModes.singleDesc: All tasks in your chosen color (settings → Task Color)
colorModes.rainbowDesc: Each task gets a unique color based on ID
colorModes.statusDesc: Gray (not started) → Yellow (started) → Blue (in progress) → Green (completed)

calendar.title: Calendar Conflicts
calendar.conflict: If a task is assigned on a non-working day per resource calendar, a warning appears.
calendar.example: Example: Task on Saturday, but resource 'John' has 5-day work week
calendar.calculation: System considers working calendars when calculating duration.

what.title: What is it
what.nodesDesc: Rectangles with task name, start and finish dates
what.arrowsDesc: Show the sequence of work execution
what.goal: Purpose: Analyze project logic, find bottlenecks

reading.title: How to Read the Diagram
reading.sequential: Arrow to the right — sequential dependency
reading.parallel: Parallel nodes without links — tasks can be done simultaneously
reading.critical: Long chain of red nodes — critical path (delay of any task shifts the entire project)

features.title: Features
features.doubleClick: Double-click on node → open task properties

hierarchy.title: Project Structure
hierarchy.desc: WBS (Work Breakdown Structure) is a visual representation of task hierarchy as a tree.
hierarchy.purpose: Allows viewing project structure, task grouping by phases, and nesting levels.
hierarchy.collapse: Expand/collapse branches for convenient project navigation

overallocation.title: Resource Overload
overallocation.desc: Overload occurs when total resource utilization exceeds 100%.
overallocation.solution: Redistribute resource utilization percentages across tasks or assign additional workers.

purpose.title: Purpose
purpose.desc: Task table with resource assignment capabilities.
purpose.main: Main function — distributing resources across tasks and specifying the utilization percentage for each resource on a specific task.

resources.title: Working with Resources
resources.assign: Click on 'Resources' column opens assignment dialog
resources.percent: Specify utilization percentage for each assigned resource
resources.dates: Change start and finish dates (for regular tasks)

readonly.title: Monitoring Mode
readonly.purpose: This view is designed exclusively for visual tracking of progress and analysis of deviations from the baseline.
readonly.noDrag: Changing dates via drag and drop
readonly.hint: Use the main Gantt chart to make changes

metrics.title: Tracking Metrics
metrics.progressDesc: Execution progress (green fill on the bar)

visualization.title: Visualization
visualization.tasks: Tasks displayed as bars on dates

dragDrop.title: Drag & Drop
dragDrop.move: Drag tasks to other dates with mouse
dragDrop.duration: Task duration is preserved when moving
dragDrop.conflict: Dependency conflict warning dialog appears when needed

management.title: Report Management
management.printDesc: Print button opens system print dialog

calendars.title: Work Calendars
calendars.personal: Each work resource can have its own work calendar
calendars.defaultDesc: 8 hours per day, 5 days per week

split_task.title: Split Task
split_task.split_hint: Select a date within the task interval

gantt.title: Gantt Chart
gantt.controls_hint: Mouse wheel to zoom • Drag to pan
gantt.link_disabled_self: Cannot link a task to itself
gantt.link_disabled_summary: Cannot link to a summary task
gantt.link_disabled_cycle: Link would create a dependency cycle
gantt.dependency_conflict_subtitle_same_day: Successor starts on the same day the predecessor ends
gantt.dependency_conflict_consequences_body: The successor starts before the predecessor ends. This breaks dependency logic: critical path and reports may be calculated incorrectly, and project duration and dates will become invalid.
gantt.dependency_conflict_consequences_body_sa: In day-based scheduling, the successor should start on the next working day after the predecessor ends. Starting on the same calendar day is considered overlap and may lead to incorrect critical path and report calculations.
gantt.dependency_conflict_consequences_leave_t: If you leave it as is
gantt.dependency_conflict_consequences_leave_b: The link will contradict the dates. The schedule will be incorrect, with possible errors on recalc, export, and in reports.
The link will be marked as having a date conflict. It is recommended to start the successor on the day after the predecessor ends.
gantt.dependency_conflict_subtitle_during_or_e: Successor starts during predecessor or when it ends
gantt.dependency_conflict_consequences_body_be: The successor starts before the predecessor has started. This breaks dependency logic: critical path and reports may be calculated incorrectly, and project duration and dates will become invalid.
gantt.dependency_conflict_consequences_body_du: The successor starts during the predecessor or on its end date. By the link it should start the day after the predecessor ends. Otherwise critical path and reports may be calculated incorrectly.
gantt.dependency_conflict_consequences_leave_b: The link will contradict the dates. The schedule will be incorrect, with possible errors on recalc, export, and in reports.
The link will contradict the dates. It is recommended to start the successor on the day after the predecessor ends.
gantt.confirm_conflict_subtitle_same_day: Successor starts on the same day the predecessor ends
gantt.confirm_conflict_message: Dates will not be auto-corrected. The link will be created as is. This may lead to incorrect schedule display and critical path calculation. Continue?
gantt.confirm_conflict_message_same_day: Dates will remain unchanged. Per scheduling rules, the successor is recommended to start the next day. Do you confirm keeping the current dates?
gantt.confirm_conflict_subtitle_during_or_end: Successor starts during predecessor or when it ends
gantt.confirm_conflict_message_before_predeces: Dates will not be auto-corrected. The link will be kept as is. This may lead to incorrect schedule display and critical path calculation. Continue?
gantt.confirm_conflict_message_during_or_end: Dates will remain unchanged. Per scheduling rules, the successor is recommended to start the day after the predecessor ends. Do you confirm keeping the current dates?

reports.project_summary_desc: General overview of status, progress and key indicators.
reports.critical_tasks_desc: List of tasks on the critical path.
reports.resources_desc: Analysis of resource allocation and workload.
reports.costs_desc: Financial analysis of budget and actual expenses.
reports.generated_footer: This report was automatically generated by PlanPro system.
